content.description: A sloping wall with a wide variety of hand and foot holds. The removal of loose blocks has exposed rock previously hidden away, making it appear more orange than the rest of the wall. Arguably the easiest route at Emigrant Lake.
content.protection: Protected by 4 bolts. Anchor consists of 2 bolts
content.location: This route shares a belay station with Mr. Anderson, but goes to the right instead of straight up. The belay station is just before the trail along the crag becomes a steep scramble to the chimney at the left end of the wall.

content.description: Starts near base of scramble. Tops out onto scramble In front of Mr Anderson. Good warmup before you get on the wall!
content.location: Short 'boulder" to the left of the beginning of the main scramble that runs up to Hippie Teacher.

content.description: Difficult route with 2 roof problems that are also cruxes. Don't stray too far left on the first roof for the full grade. Caution: do not miss the fourth bolt!
content.protection: Protected by 5 bolts. Anchor consists of 2 bolts with rap rings
content.location: Furthest right route on the Poison Oak Wall. A sloped surface makes it difficult but not impossible to belay. Route begins below the roof at the right end of the wall.

content.description: A good warm up or learning route with easy moves with lots of good holds. If you go to the right, the bolts can be a bit of a reach, but a variety of cracks and ledges provide good stability. 3 bolts
content.protection: Route is protected by 3 bolts. The anchor has rap rings
content.location: The belay station is located on the left of the Poison Oak Wall, just before the trail becomes quite steep up to the chimney at the end of the crag.

content.description: Steep start leads to an easy climb. This route joins Cornholio at the fourth bolt, where it finishes on the same 10a direct face (no stepping off to the left ledge).
content.protection: Protected by 6 bolts. Anchor consists of 2 bolts with rap rings
content.location: Located just to the right of Cornholio, around the end of the belay platform. It is best to belay from the same spot as Cornholio due to the narrow and sloped start of the route.

content.description: Low angle on bottom, with a steeper face up top. Friction with horizontal cracks. The furthest left route on the Poison Oak Wall, and also the shortest. Watch out for poison oak!
content.protection: Protected by 3 bolts. Anchor has two bolts with rap rings
content.location: The furthest route to the left on Poison Oak wall. The start of the route is near the top of the steep scramble, so belaying can be difficult.

content.description: Great holds at the start create interesting moves to the first bolt. Easy climbing from there until you reach the fourth bolt, where the face creates an exciting finish. The 10a rating is for the direct finish on the face (no stepping off to the left ledge).
content.protection: Protected by 5 bolts. Anchor consists of 2 bolts with rap rings
content.location: Route begins in the main belay platform at the right side of the Poison Oak Wall where the approach trail reaches the wall. It is located in the middle of the face at the open area. A sharp boulder makes the start a little easier.

content.description:
Route follows a set of cracks up a slightly overhung wall on the left side of the gully. The route eases up before the anchor, but make sure to avoid loose rocks on the ground there. You can access the anchor for Top Roping by taking the scramble at the end of the gully, and walking to the rocks above the left side of the gully. 

 If you fall while climbing, beware of swinging into the wall behind you
content.location: Walk all the way to the left side of the poison oak wall into the cave/gully area. The climb begins on the left side with the obvious crack. A bit further on the right is a small scramble to the top where you can access the anchors.

content.description: Smaller holds with a small bulge near the start. A vertical crack provides a nice variety of holds
content.protection: Protected by 5 bolts. Anchor is two bolts with rap rings
content.location: Belay station is near a large rock, just above a small tree. The second bolt is located on a small bulge with a black stain underneath it.

content.description: Easy start with a slopy middle. This section requires a lot of balance. The face at the end is an enjoyable challenge for the end of a solid route.
content.protection: Protected by 5 bolts. Anchor consists of 2 bolts
content.location: The beginning of the route is just below the small tree near the wall. The climb begins just before some "steps" on the trail as it goes along the side of the tree.

content.description: Great warm up route with small holds. The crux is getting through the face at the third bolt. Small handholds and footholds make a nice challenge.
content.protection: Protected by 4 bolts. Anchor is two bolts with rap rings
content.location:
Shares a belay area with Bug Off, just above the small tree.

The bolt line goes to the right of the bulge with the black stain underneath it.

content.description: Good place for first leads and easy to set up TRs. The area contains 9 routes that are fully bolted, including anchors. The top is easily accessed by scrambling up to the top at the far left side of the wall. Poison Oak is also abundant in the area, but it isn't so bad in the winter when the leaves have fallen off.
